value: is about 45 minutes away from the island and is served by seven airlines. The airport is directly served by Interstate 95 and is located about 20 minutes north of Savannah.

It's about 18 miles from Savannah along route 80, and most of the highway has no bike lanes or paved shoulder to ride on.  However, it is a scenic ride, and flat.

The island is quite accessible by bike, and is the preferred method of getting around with a more relaxed, beach attitude.  Bikes can be rented for this purpose

value: content=Georgia's oldest and tallest lighthouse, includes a complex of historic support buildings and 187 steps to the top!
directions=Directly in front of the Tybee pier and pavilion
content=Part science center and part aquarium, featuring touch tanks and many kid friendly exhibits.
name=Tybee Island Museum at Fort Screven's Battery Garland
directions=Directly across from the Tybee Island Light Station

content=Located inside a coastal defense fort first used during the Spanish American War, this museum outlines the history of Tybee Island as an integral part of America's coastal defense system. Don't miss the WWII submarine periscope located just inside the entrance.

content=An imposing Civil War era fort designed to protect the coastal region of Savannah. The fort was the site of a siege battle between the Confederates who usurped the fort and Union soldiers determined to take it over. The 7.5 foot solid brick walls still feature cannon fire damage.
content=Rent bikes to see the island at a relaxed pace. Can also call ahead to have bikes delivered to where you're staying.
content=Be aware that Tybee Island is very strict about preserving its beach; dogs and glass bottles are forbidden, and fines are very steep.
content=Offers guided kayak tours through salt marshes, rivers, and other coastal waterways. Trips available for all skill levels.
content=Hip surf shop with bathing suits, boogie boards, and of course surf ware.
content=Great neighborhood setting on the back river. Serves seafood outside on a dock which is the setting for some spectacular sunsets.
content=Laid back seafood restaurant with extravagant decorations and a zany atmosphere. Be sure to buy some gator food to feed the live alligators!
directions=at the corner of Hwy 80 & Jones Avenue
content=Fine dining featuring both traditional southern dishes and seafood.

content=Large restaurant with full bar overlooking the beach; has an open-air dining area on the second floor. Ask to sit in the boat if you have young kids who want to steer a ship while enjoying a meal.
content=Seafood, ocean views, happy hour specials 3PM-7PM daily. Sports on the HD TVs.
content=Oceanfront property with rooms and condominiums available.
content=Over 120 unique homes, cottages, and condos in all Tybee Island locations. Oceanfront, Luxury to Budget Friendly. Exceptional customer service and quality properties.
content=Oceanfront Hotel Rooms & Luxury 3-Bedroom Condos on Tybee Island Beach.

content=Makes a handful of some of the finest properties on the Island available to your family. Most accommodations are right on the beach. Each property is furnished with all of the conveniences of home, just bring your favorite beach chair and swimsuit.
content=An officer's beach cottage (ca. 1911) with 3 rooms.

content= Tybee Island’s ONLY Beachfront Hotel! The DeSoto Beach Hotel is located less than 20 minutes from Historic Downtown Savannah, 45 minutes from the Savannah/Hilton Head International Airport, and only steps from Tybee Island’s beautiful beachfront.
